alert.note: Alert for Aroostook; Piscataquis; Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 21 at 3:45PM EDT until July 21 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL PISCATAQUIS...NORTHWESTERN AROOSTOOK AND SOMERSET COUNTIES... At 344 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Saint Pamphile to near Nine-mile Bridge to 9 miles southeast of Saint Juste, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Clayton Lake, Saint Pamphile and Nine-mile Bridge. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Radar has indicated some rotation neaer Nine Mile Bridge. This severe thunderstorm has some potential for producing a tornado, although forecaster confidence is not high enough to issue a tornado warning at this time. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
